  • Method Details

    • registerAll

      public static void registerAll(@NonNull com.badlogic.gdx.utils.Json json)
      Registers the classes from jdkgdxds and from SquidSquad with the given Json object, allowing it to read and write types from both libraries.
      Parameters:
      json - a libGDX Json object that will have serializers registered for all jdkgdxds and SquidSquad types this is aware of

    • registerChar2D

      public static void registerChar2D(@NonNull com.badlogic.gdx.utils.Json json)
      Registers char[][] with the given Json object, so char[][] can be written to and read from JSON.
      Parameters:
      json - a libGDX Json object that will have a serializer registered

    • registerInt2D

      public static void registerInt2D(@NonNull com.badlogic.gdx.utils.Json json)
      Registers int[][] with the given Json object, so int[][] can be written to and read from JSON.
      Parameters:
      json - a libGDX Json object that will have a serializer registered

      Registers float[][] with the given Json object, so float[][] can be written to and read from JSON.
      Parameters:
      json - a libGDX Json object that will have a serializer registered

    • registerLong2D

      public static void registerLong2D(@NonNull com.badlogic.gdx.utils.Json json)
      Registers long[][] with the given Json object, so long[][] can be written to and read from JSON.
      Parameters:
      json - a libGDX Json object that will have a serializer registered

    • registerDiceRule

      public static void registerDiceRule(@NonNull com.badlogic.gdx.utils.Json json)
      Registers Dice.Rule with the given Json object, so Dice.Rule can be written to and read from JSON. This stores a Rule succinctly, using the String representation of its rollCode only.
      Note that Dice itself can be serialized using Json without a serializer, as long as either the EnhancedRandom implementation used with it has been registered, or JsonSupport.registerAtomicLong(Json) has been called. Calling either registerAll(Json) or JsonSupport.registerAll(Json) will also suffice.
      Parameters:
      json - a libGDX Json object that will have a serializer registered

    • registerGapShuffler

      public static void registerGapShuffler(@NonNull com.badlogic.gdx.utils.Json json)
      Registers GapShuffler with the given Json object, so GapShuffler can be written to and read from JSON. This registers serialization/deserialization for ObjectList as well, since GapShuffler requires it. You should either register the EnhancedRandom you use with this (which is TricycleRandom if unspecified), use JsonSupport.registerAtomicLong(Json) (if you don't know what type the random number generator uses), or just call registerAll(Json).
      Parameters:
      json - a libGDX Json object that will have a serializer registered

    • registerProbabilityTable

      public static void registerProbabilityTable(@NonNull com.badlogic.gdx.utils.Json json)
      Registers ProbabilityTable with the given Json object, so ProbabilityTable can be written to and read from JSON. This registers serialization/deserialization for ObjectList as well, since ProbabilityTable requires it. You should either register the EnhancedRandom you use with this (which is WhiskerRandom if unspecified), use JsonSupport.registerEnhancedRandom(Json) (if you don't know what type the random number generator uses), or just call registerAll(Json).
      Parameters:
      json - a libGDX Json object that will have a serializer registered

    • registerWeightedTable

      public static void registerWeightedTable(@NonNull com.badlogic.gdx.utils.Json json)
      Registers WeightedTable with the given Json object, so WeightedTable can be written to and read from JSON. This is a simple wrapper around WeightedTable's built-in WeightedTable.serializeToString() and WeightedTable.deserializeFromString(String) methods.
      Parameters:
      json - a libGDX Json object that will have a serializer registered

    • registerIntShuffler

      public static void registerIntShuffler(@NonNull com.badlogic.gdx.utils.Json json)
      Registers IntShuffler with the given Json object, so IntShuffler can be written to and read from JSON. This is a simple wrapper around IntShuffler's built-in IntShuffler.serializeToString() and IntShuffler.deserializeFromString(String) methods.
      Parameters:
      json - a libGDX Json object that will have a serializer registered

    • registerInterpolator

      public static void registerInterpolator(@NonNull com.badlogic.gdx.utils.Json json)
      Registers Interpolator with the given Json object, so Interpolator can be written to and read from JSON. This is a simple wrapper around each Interpolator's unique Interpolations.Interpolator.getTag() and Interpolations.get(String) to read it back.
      Parameters:
      json - a libGDX Json object that will have a serializer registered

    • registerPattern

      public static void registerPattern(@NonNull com.badlogic.gdx.utils.Json json)
      Registers Pattern with the given Json object, so Pattern can be written to and read from JSON. This is a simple wrapper around Pattern's built-in Pattern.serializeToString() and Pattern.deserializeFromString(String) methods. Note that Pattern is in regexodus, a dependency of squidcore.
      Parameters:
      json - a libGDX Json object that will have a serializer registered
